column1: This document explains the data in these sheets, which analyze ClinVar variant evidence for genes with dosage sensitivity curations.
Only variants that meet ALL of these criteria:
• Associated with a single gene (not multi-gene variants)
• Smaller than 1,000 base pairs (excludes large structural variants)
• Have a germline disease classification in ClinVar

column2: The ClinVar release date for this data
Haploinsufficiency score from ClinGen Dosage (0-3, or special values)
Triplosensitivity score from ClinGen Dosage (0-3, or special values)
Total number of variants in ClinVar for this gene
Variants with 1-star or higher review status
Variants classified as Pathogenic or Likely Pathogenic (P/LP)
P/LP variants with 1-star or higher review status
Predicted Loss-of-Function variants (see pLOF section below)
pLOF variants with 1-star or higher review status
Variants that are both P/LP AND pLOF
P/LP + pLOF variants with 1-star or higher review status
Up to 10 example ClinVar Variation IDs (for reference)
The ClinVar release date for this data
The grouping category: HI Score Summary, TS Score Summary, or Overall Total
The specific score value within that category
Number of genes in this category
Sum of all variants across genes in this category
Average P/LP 1-star pLOF variants per gene

column1: A variant is considered pLOF if its molecular consequence is one of:

column2: No assertion criteria provided, or conflicting interpretations
Two or more submitters with assertion criteria, no conflicts
Gene associated with autosomal recessive phenotype

column1: The most relevant column is: plp_one_star_plof_variants
This represents high-confidence pathogenic loss-of-function variants:
This metric helps establish whether a gene has sufficient evidence of pathogenic
loss-of-function variants to support mechanism curation decisions.
To view a variant, use the variation IDs from sample_variation_ids:
